comment.author: 25767425@N02
comment._content: Is she in an empty swimming pool???

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: "On August 10, 1913 Dolly Meyer and Myrtle Wright ventured the Golden Gate crossing [San Francisco, California -- before the Golden Gate Bridge was built] and both succeeded in their goal, the former with a time of one hour 28 minutes, the latter a much quicker one hour and 31 seconds. Members of the California Life Saving and Swimming Club, they were started by Captain Clark, who set them off at 11 a.m. on their course from Fort Point to Lime Point."

comment.author: 49981395@N03
comment._content: I love the sense of beauty captured in her face. She seems very confident in pursuing her endeavors through her body movement. This picture is just magnificent!

comment.author: 28105615@N00
comment._content: This is my Great, Great Maternal Grandmother. She was a total Bad Ass, unfortunately I never got to meet her, but I did get to spend quite a bit of my childhood with her daughter (my great grandmother) and her granddaughter (my grandmother) who were both total bad ass, and strong women as well.
